an10.82:1.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an10.82:2.1: “Ānanda, it’s not possible for a faithless mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:3.1: It’s not possible for a mendicant who is unethical …
an10.82:11.1: of wrong view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:12.1: It’s not possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:13.1: It is possible for a faithful mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:14.1: It is possible for a mendicant who is ethical …
an10.82:22.1: of right view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:23.1: It is possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
